title: Missing at U.N.’s Climate Meeting: American Executives
summary: Many business leaders are skipping the annual United Nations climate summit in Belém, Brazil, or are attending events in other cities.

title: Newsom in the Spotlight at the Climate Conference That Trump Decided to Skip
summary: The California governor painted the president as a threat to American competitiveness by letting China dominate the renewable energy industry.

title: There’s a New Forecast for Peak Oil Demand. It’s Increasingly Cloudy.
summary: The International Energy Agency once projected that oil and gas demand could level off by 2030. Now it’s backing off, sort of.

title: The Governor in the Spotlight at Climate Talks, and Escalating Violence in the West Bank
summary: Plus, why private air travel is booming.

title: House Returns After Long Recess to Take Up Bill to End Shutdown
summary: After a 54-day break, the House is expected to vote on the Senate-passed spending deal. Approval would clear it for President Trump’s signature.

title: What if Democrats’ Big Shutdown Loss Turns Out to Be a Win?
summary: Despite considerable hand-wringing in the party about caving to Republicans in the government closure, some Democrats see potential upsides in the outcome.

title: Supreme Court Extends Order Allowing Limits on Food Stamp Payments
summary: The justices allowed the Trump administration to withhold full benefits for two more days while Congress worked to advance a government funding bill.

title: The I.R.S. Tried to Stop This Tax Dodge. Scott Bessent Used It Anyway.
summary: Like many on Wall Street, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent used a limited partnership to avoid Medicare taxes. Unlike the others, he’s now overseeing the I.R.S.

title: Xi’s Military Purges Show Unease About China’s Nuclear Forces
summary: The shake-up in China’s armed forces comes as both Beijing and Washington are pushing through major changes in their country’s militaries, in different ways.

title: Blood and Tears as Spain’s Troubled Bullfighting Star Hangs Up His Cape
summary: José Antonio Morante Camacho says he has fought his last bull. Fans appreciated his artistry but also his honesty about his struggles with mental illness.

title: Jack Schlossberg, Social Media Provocateur, Gives Politics a Try
summary: As he prepares a Congressional run, J.F.K.’s grandson admits, “I’m not for everybody.”

title: Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy Heir, to Seek Nadler’s N.Y. Congressional Seat
summary: Mr. Schlossberg, the son of Caroline Kennedy, said the Democratic Party needed someone who could stand up to President Trump and his allies.

title: Why Factories Will Keep Looking for Alternatives to China
summary: A trade truce between the United States and China has calmed nerves, but it won’t stop the broader movement of companies to countries like Vietnam.

title: What It Takes to Move a Factory From China to Vietnam
summary: Tariffs have forced Chinese companies to move their operations to Vietnam. Alexandra Stevenson, our Shanghai bureau chief, visits a factory in Ho Chi Minh City to see how one of the biggest challenges isn’t relocating machinery and tools, but overcoming language barriers.

title: Halt in Fees on Chinese Vessels Endangers U.S. Shipbuilding Efforts
summary: The two countries agreed to suspend the fees for a year as part of their recent trade pact, but America still aims to build more commercial ships.

title: Scientists Grow More Hopeful About Ending a Global Organ Shortage
summary: At an international conference, researchers at the forefront of animal-human transplantation compared notes and allowed themselves the first real optimism in decades.

title: A Look Into the Early Days of Migrant Detentions at Guantánamo
summary: Government employees distributed Bibles and prepared materials “commonly used in Hinduism, Sikhism and Rastafarianism,” according to emails.

title: Trump Administration Plans to Send Border Patrol to Charlotte and New Orleans
summary: Plans for the operations were still being finalized, according to a federal official with knowledge of them.

title: Senator Criticizes Rubio for Paying $7.5 Million to Equatorial Guinea to Take Deportees
summary: Senator Jeanne Shaheen, Democrat of New Hampshire, said the African country has a long history of corruption. The amount paid is far more than recent annual assistance given to it.

title: What Are Antidepressants Doing to Teen Sexual Development
summary: Research on adults who take S.S.R.I.s shows they tamp down sexual desire. Why aren’t we studying what that could mean for adolescents who take them?

title: What to Know About Teen Sexual Development and S.S.R.I.s
summary: There is basically no research that looks at the impact of antidepressants on emerging sexuality. Here are the key things we do know.

title: Deadly Blasts in India and Pakistan Set Region on Edge
summary: The rare explosions in the country’s capitals have not been directly linked, but there are fears the governments will blame each other after their previous military conflict alarmed the world.

title: Ghana, Home of Kente Cloth, Cracks Down on Which Textiles Are Authentic
summary: As the vibrantly patterned kente travels out of Africa, a new designation aims to protect its ties to Ghana, where the cloth originated.

title: Most Women Can Still Get Abortion Pills. That May Soon Change.
summary: American women need the freedom to determine the course of their own lives.

title: The Business Elite Needs Mamdani. They Just Don’t Know It Yet.
summary: The threat from Washington is going to require teamwork.

title: Josh Johnson Isn’t Sold on Trump’s 50-Year Mortgage Plan
summary: “This seems like a bad idea. And if Black people could get loans, I’d be worried,” Johnson said on “The Daily Show.”

title: Syria’s Leaders Pledge to Join Fight Against Islamic State
summary: Large parts of Syria were once overrun by the terrorist group Islamic State. The country’s new government has just committed to a global effort to fight the group.

title: Kansas County Agrees to Pay $3 Million Over Police Raid of Newspaper
summary: The search of The Marion County Record’s office in 2023 touched off a national conversation about press freedom.

title: Linda Sun, Former Aide to NY Governors, Is on Trial, Accused of Helping China
summary: Linda Sun, who worked for Kathy Hochul and Andrew M. Cuomo, had luxury watches and cars that prosecutors say were rewards for boosting the country’s agenda.

title: Northern Lights Dazzle in U.S. Skies as Far South as Alabama
summary: The night skies across the United States lit up as fast-moving charged particles from the sun slammed into the Earth’s atmosphere.
